image.altText: A digital sign that says "London Circuit Closure 12 March" on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The eastern side of London Circuit closed last night until late 2026 to allow for light rail construction and footpath improvements, but the businesses affected are feeling positive about the construction "because we'll have a far more modernised area to work from".

title.children: 'I do think we will get through this': Roads close in Canberra's CBD until late 2026

image.altText: A photo which shows Gove refinery from the air. Gove Operations is located on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem land.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has lost a High Court battle over whether it should be liable for compensation for lost or impaired native title rights over a mining lease on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem Land.

title.children: Commonwealth loses High Court battle in native title compensation claim over Gove Peninsula

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: ACT Policing releases dash-cam footage allegedly showing a 25-year-old Gungahlin man ramming other cars with his ute and breaking the back window of a moving car while in its tray and repeatedly kicking the driver.

title.children: Police release footage of violent road rage incidents in Canberra

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A woman who received threatening photos of bullets and a suspected pipe bomb from her former partner details how she fled their home with their young children just weeks after giving birth.

title.children: Woman lives in 'constant fear' from ex-partner's violence, court hears

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with a sign reading "Zaab".

props.synopsis: The woman, now aged 54, told the Supreme Court the stairs were poorly lit and alleged the restaurant was negligent by failing to repair the uneven surface.

title.children: Woman awarded $284K in damages after falling at Braddon restaurant

image.altText: Paul laughs while sitting in a chair, wearing a blue shirt, glasses and lanyard hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: The head of orthopaedic surgery at Canberrra Hospital resigns, along with several other surgeons, citing concerns over operational decisions being made by Canberra Health Services.

title.children: Canberra orthopaedic surgeons resign citing operational concerns

image.altText: Looking down a reflective pool to a multi level, dome-adorned sandstone building. Walls of red poppies can be seen.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: Fears Australia's 'solemn' war memorial risks becoming a 'Disneyland of war'

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink and orange singlet and shiny sunglasses running.

props.synopsis: Around 200 people have turned out in Canberra's south to take part in a solidarity run, after a female runner was allegedly grabbed by a man at Tuggeranong Hill last weekend.

title.children: 'She's not alone': Runners gather in solidarity after woman allegedly grabbed by man

image.altText: A man standing in front of a truck wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: A new report on Islamophobia in Australia has found a steep increase in assaults, abuse and threats.

title.children: Cars set alight, people hit, abuse on social media. Islamophobia is on the rise

image.altText: firefighter holds hose sending water up into trees that are on fire.

props.synopsis: A national overhaul of text message warnings for people at threat of a disaster is still years away, with the federal government confirming there's been a three-year blowout to its original plans.

title.children: Overdue national mobile disaster alert system still years away

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: A head and shoulders profile shot of Terence John Fisher posing for a photo with a bushy beard.

props.synopsis: Evolving DNA technology helps WA Police identify Terence John Fisher as the man they suspect killed Perth woman Kerryn Tate 45 years ago, with his name also linked to two other unsolved murders.

title.children: Police name suspect in 1979 cold case murder after DNA breakthrough

image.altText: A green tent in a park. An empty black camping chair next to it.

props.synopsis: The decision was made after the City of Moreton Bay made homeless camping a crime on public land, with the Brisbane mayor saying the city can no longer take a "compassionate and flexible approach".

title.children: Brisbane mayor vows to evict homeless campers within 24 hours

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The mission for the return of two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station was scrubbed over a technical issue with the rocket's launch pad.

title.children: SpaceX delays mission to replace NASA's stranded astronauts

image.altText: Manele in chair

props.synopsis: In an exclusive interview, and the first time a Solomon Islands leader has sat down with the ABC in almost six years, new prime minister Jeremiah Manele says 'differences' remain over a new policing agreement with Australia.

title.children: Solomon Islands leader takes aim at Trump over 'regrettable' climate position

image.altText: People carry garbage bags picking up rubbish on a beach.

props.synopsis: Queensland's bay islands act as a natural buffer protecting the mainland from severe storm surges, and helped save Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: The islands that saved millions from Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A women wearing chocolate brown top and skirt is holding the bottom of her belly.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says governments are shirking "meaningful action" to close the gap, as new data shows only four of the national targets are on track.

title.children: ‘Definition of insanity’: Close the gap failures laid bare

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is on the rise following a recovery in US stocks driven by a rally in the beaten-down tech sector. Follow live.

title.children: Business live: ASX on the up after tech-led Wall St share rebound

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX flat at midday after modest gains
Union worried US trying to ‘steal’ Australian steel industry

image.altText: An artist's impression of the airport metro station.

props.synopsis: A re-elected federal Labor government plans to inject $1 billion into securing a rail corridor from Sydney's south-western suburbs to the new Western Sydney airport.

title.children: 'Half-baked': Concern over PM's $1bn pledge for Sydney rail corridor

image.altText: CCTV of a man wearing a face mask.

props.synopsis: A 91-year-old Victorian woman thought she was handing her bank card over for protection from fraudulent charges, but it was a scam.

title.children: Police launch search after $130,000 stolen from elderly woman

image.altText: A street with a sign saying "Karangi".

props.synopsis: Police say the women, 41 and 51, were present when a woman gave birth at a property near Coffs Harbour in 2022.

title.children: Women face manslaughter charges after death of baby born at home

image.altText: A feral pig at a waterhole.

props.synopsis: Female pigs may be the "factories" of feral populations, but a new study suggests male pigs are the disease "super spreaders" and should be targeted in culling programs.

title.children: Male feral pigs identified as disease 'super spreaders'

image.altText: The Ore Obelisk being removed in 2021

props.synopsis: Members of Perth's arts community are questioning why beloved local sculptures have been placed in storage indefinitely while the City of Perth spends money installing a new piece from a US artist.

title.children: Public art removed for safety reasons will not be returned, dismaying artists

image.altText: A woman stands beside a hospital bed in a medical imaging room.

props.synopsis: When Rose Kruze started suffering from debilitating headaches, she had no idea they were a symptom of an under-diagnosed brain condition.

title.children: Retired nurse's crippling headaches lead to rare diagnosis

image.altText: A pink and purple drawing of a boy sitting down in court, arms folded.

props.synopsis: Amy says she has not slept in six months, waiting for a knock on the door to learn her 15-year-old son has been injured, or worse. She supports the Victorian government's proposal to tighten bail laws.

title.children: Mother says justice system let her son down by having 'no consequences'

image.altText: A large tree across a road and powerlines.

props.synopsis: More than 33,000 properties remain without power across south-east Queensland, with about half of the outages on the Gold Coast

title.children: Energex crews 'literally with machetes' as recovery turns to challenging areas

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks annoyed

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur was off kilter in his straight sets defeat against Argentine 25th seed Francisco Cerúndolo as his last-16 hoodoo at Indian Wells continues.

title.children: Error-strewn de Minaur crashes out of Indian Wells

image.altText: a woman wearing glasses and a paisley dress sitting in a dark room

props.synopsis: Lawyers say they are being repeatedly knocked back from visiting their clients inside Darwin Correctional Centre, as the Northern Territory's prison population continues to rise.

title.children: Lawyers sound alarm over denied Darwin prison visits

image.altText: Cassandra smiles as she looks to the camera in a mid-shot. Her hair is curled in loose waves and she wears lipstick.

props.synopsis: As a bestselling author, Cassandra Clare has faced her fair share of controversy. Back with a new fantasy series that draws on her Jewish cultural background, she isn't letting potential reader reactions stop her from exploring complex themes in her work.

title.children: Why controversy follows fantasy author Cassandra Clare

image.altText: An older trans woman sits on set in front of a pink background next to a young trans man

props.synopsis: From transgender rights to gender euphoria, 71-year-old trans liberation pioneer Dr Jess Hooley and 23-year-old musician and trans man Flynn Sant (aka flowerkid) compare being trans in the past and present.

title.children: Trans people have always been here — two generations talk about what's changed

image.altText: A journalist wears sunglasses, helmet and a vest with a "press" badge as he carries a camera tripod on his left shoulder.

props.synopsis: Afghans who fled after the Taliban takeover were all set for new lives in the United States until Donald Trump signed an executive order pausing the refugee program, leaving people with approved visas and booked flights dreading a return to Taliban rule.

title.children: Afghans who helped America fight the Taliban could be sent back

image.altText: A man peers out from a large broken window.

props.synopsis: While both countries claim they want peace, there's previously been significant differences between what Kyiv and Moscow have said they'd be prepared to agree to, and there's still plenty that needs to happen before fighting stops.

title.children: Is a Ukraine-Russia ceasefire close? Here's what we know

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte looks emotionlessly forward at the camera with short black hair

props.synopsis: The former Philippine president is expected to face a preliminary hearing in coming days.

title.children: Rodrigo Duterte lands in the Netherlands after 'war on drugs' arrest

image.altText: A man armed with a rifle wearing camouflage gear standing alongside a green and yellow passenger train carriage

props.synopsis: Pakistan authorities say the day-long stand off involving hundreds of hostages has ended.

title.children: Pakistan's army says 21 hostages dead after train siege ends

image.altText: two women make the word love with their hands

props.synopsis: In its simplest form, the philosophy of RA rejects traditional relationship hierarchy and norms.

title.children: 'Relationship anarchy' might have you rethinking your relationships
